corpus_metadata.name: K'Cho-English Gold Standard Parallel Corpus
corpus_metadata.source: Mang & Bedell (2006, 2012) linguistic research + NT translations

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh Yóng am pàapai pe(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Om gave Yong a flower.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Yóng am pàapai pe(k) ci ah k'chàang ka hngu(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I saw the man that gave Yong a flower.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh Yóng am a péit ah pàapai ka hngu(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I saw the flower that Om gave Yong.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh pàapai a péit ah k'hngumí ka hngu(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I saw the woman that Om gave a flower to.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ka teihpüi noh Yóng am pàapai pe(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: My friend gave Yong a flower.

sentence_pairs.kcho: a teihpüi noh Yóng am pàapai pe(k) ci ah k'chàang lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The man whose friend gave Yong a flower came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh ka teihpui am pàapai pe(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Om gave my friend a flower.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh a teihpüi am pàapai a péit ah k'chàang lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The man whose friend Om gave a flower to came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh Yóng am ka pàapai pe(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Om gave Yong my flower.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om noh Yóng am a pàapai a péit ah k'hngumí lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The woman whose flower Om gave Yong came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ak'hmó noh k'khìm luum-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The child played with a knife.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om lah Tam noh htung cuh ui thah-na(k) ci goi.
sentence_pairs.english: Om and Tam beat the dog with the stick.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ak'hmó lùum ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The child played.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om lah Tam noh ui that ci goi.
sentence_pairs.english: Om and Tam beat the dog.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om ka zèi-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I like Om.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ka zèi ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I am pleased.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Tam noh Yóng k'chú-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Tam is married to Yong.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Yóng Tam ah k'chú ah kya(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Yong is Tam's wife.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om ka ng'mìng-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I am named Om.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Om ka ng'mìng ah kya(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Om is my name.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Sin ah tumat ka ka-na(k) khai.
sentence_pairs.english: I will take this one as my own.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Sin ah tumat kei ah ka ah kya(k) khai.
sentence_pairs.english: This one will be mine.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Khò-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: He has it as his land.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ka khò-na(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I have it as my land.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ka khò ah kya(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: It is my land.

sentence_pairs.kcho: ami hnguh te ah àihli lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: The star that they saw came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: àihli hgnu te ci gui.
sentence_pairs.english: They saw a star.

sentence_pairs.kcho: ami nong-bà ah hngumí k'chú-na tu bà ca k'chàang lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: A man that marries a woman that has been divorced came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: cun ah k'chàang noh ami nong-bà ah hngumí k'chú-na tu bà ci.
sentence_pairs.english: That man is marrying a woman that has been divorced.

sentence_pairs.kcho: cun ah hngumí ami nong-bà.
sentence_pairs.english: That woman has been divorced.

sentence_pairs.kcho: kä ni(k) ci ah bii bi(k) ci ah k'chàang gui lo(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Men that do things that are not good came.

sentence_pairs.kcho: cun ah k'chàang gùi noh kä ni(k) ci ah bii bi(k) ci gui.
sentence_pairs.english: Those men do things that are not good.

sentence_pairs.kcho: cun ah bii kä ni(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: That act is not good.

sentence_pairs.kcho: a-k'ní ah kä ng'theih ci ah ghíng gui phùng sì(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: Every tree that does not bear good things died.

sentence_pairs.kcho: cun ah a-ghíng gùi a-k'ní ah kä ng'theih ci gui.

sentence_pairs.kcho: àihli a ng'dáng lo-nák te ah a-ching ka hngu(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I saw the time that the star appeared.

sentence_pairs.kcho: kei on kä om tu ci cuh ka hngu(k) ci.
sentence_pairs.english: I saw he that is not with me.

sentence_pairs.english: He is not with me.

sentence_pairs.kcho: K'am zòi ci ah k'chàang lo(k) ci.

sentence_pairs.kcho: Ui noh vok htui ci.
